topics.body:
Hey here's a fun random question:
What do you think about inside your brain most of the time?


What I mean by that is obviously everybody's minds are different and our thought processes are completely different from each others' and how each individual thinks through things is totally different.
Do you *just* think about your daily life and *just* think through things from A to B or do you follow a different pattern to come to a conclusion.

In other words:
What do you think about most of the time and how do you think on things?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5353297063687265bc820000#post_5353297063687265bc820000
I have a very nonlinear but frank way of thinking. I will regularly flit from one idea to another.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5353297063687265bc820000#post_5353297063687265bc820000
I'm very analytical and fearful. I'm a very cautious person who always thinks before he acts. I'm also very pessimistic and cynical. I blame the world around me and everything I have to put up with.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body: So to those with knowledge of national history and government, why is it that political moments take so long? Why must people fight for years and years for change even if almost everyone supports that change? Take cannabis for example, people have been fighting to get it legalized for a very long time and most people out there want it legalized, so why then does the government drag it's feet? Why is change such a long and difficult process in a country where people are supposed to be the voice of government?
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53532da563687265afd60200#post_53532da563687265afd60200

Breaking the lines of burocracy and the corruption is never a short term solution. The fact that society in general doesn't know what it wants

There's also the fact that political movements are always seen as an annoyance at first becasue, and let's be honest here, nowadays everyone protests about anything, and people used to the Satus Quo of just waking up and go to their daily jobs don't like to find themselves interrupted when that happens and by the time it has got genuine support it's because it has gain monetary advantages for large parties and only then they are welcomed. And then the cycle repeats.

topics.body:
*GOD DAMN IT!*
Do you ever have one of those moments where you just want to punch a wall?

I was reading up on ufotable and a couple tv shows and movies they've made; the people that made fate/zero and fate/stay night?  They were going to make a short badass crossover of tenchou and another franchise in 2010 that looked damn good, but you know why it got canned?  Cause they didn't bother to go through the legal process of making a crossover of a franchise owned by another company and fucked up copyright wise.

That'd be like making a marvel vs capcom game and forgetting to ask capcom their permission until you had already finished it.

There's stupid and then there's "What did you expect exactly?" levels stupid.
